file.title: Accessing or Modifying Element Properties
file.h3: Once you have retrieved an element or list of elements, you can make modifications if desired. We will be covering accessing or modification of the inner HTML of the element, an attribute of the element, and the style of an element.
file.p: Accessing or Modifying Inner HTML and Text
file.bullet: Inner HTML is the content within the open and close tag of an HTML element. This can be retrieved or updated via the innerHTML property on the element you are working with.

The property innerText behaves in a similar manner, but it ignores any HTML tags. This can be useful if are just concerned with the text a user sees, or if we do not want to allow them to inject HTML tags in our page.

file.bullet: In addition to retrieving or updating an element's inner HTML, the element's attributes can also be accessed and updated. We can do this using a handful of methods.

data-* attribute
In HTML 5, data-* attributes can be added to HTML elements to provide metadata for an element. The meta data is typically used to tie the html field to the database.
The * portion of the name must be at least one character long and should be all lower case.
